summary: The NCAA Accountability Act of 2025 mandates due process requirements for investigations of intercollegiate athletic programs and member institutions. It requires covered athletic associations, those with at least 900 member institutions, to provide written notices of investigation, notices of allegations, and adhere to hearing requirements.  It allows arbitration for disputes and requires annual reports to the Attorney General and State Attorneys General. The Attorney General will establish procedures for investigating potential violations, with potential penalties including civil fines and removal of governing body members.  The Act also defines key terms like “covered athletic association” and “member institution.”
